title: Hydrostatic Pressure and Pascal's Law - Multiple Choice Questions
subtitle: NIOS Class 12 Physics - Chapter 9 (Part 1)

questions.question: What is pressure defined as?
questions.explanation: Pressure is defined as the normal force or thrust per unit area exerted by a fluid. P = Thrust/Area.

questions.question: The SI unit of pressure is:
questions.explanation: The SI unit of pressure is Pascal (Pa), which is equal to N/m². It is named after French scientist Blaise Pascal.

questions.question: Hydrostatic pressure at depth h in a liquid of density ρ is given by:
questions.explanation: Hydrostatic pressure increases linearly with depth according to P = ρgh, where ρ is density, g is gravitational acceleration, and h is depth.

questions.question: Why are dam walls thicker at the bottom?
options: Due to increased hydrostatic pressure with depth
questions.explanation: Dam walls are thicker at the bottom because hydrostatic pressure increases linearly with depth (P = ρgh), requiring stronger walls to withstand greater pressure.

questions.question: The absolute pressure at depth h below the surface of a liquid exposed to atmosphere is:
questions.explanation: Absolute pressure at depth h is the sum of atmospheric pressure and gauge pressure: P = Patm + ρgh.

questions.question: Standard atmospheric pressure is approximately:
questions.explanation: Standard atmospheric pressure is 1.01 × 10⁵ Pa, as determined by Torricelli's barometer experiment with mercury.

questions.question: In Torricelli's barometer, mercury rises to a height of:
questions.explanation: In Torricelli's barometer, mercury rises to 76 cm (0.76 m) height, which balances atmospheric pressure.

questions.question: According to Archimedes' principle, buoyant force equals:
questions.explanation: Archimedes' principle states that buoyant force on an object equals the weight of fluid displaced by the object.

questions.question: A floating object displaces fluid equal to:
questions.explanation: A floating object displaces fluid equal to its own weight, maintaining equilibrium between gravitational force and buoyant force.

questions.question: Pascal's law states that pressure applied to an enclosed liquid is:
questions.explanation: Pascal's law states that pressure applied to any part of an enclosed liquid is transmitted undiminished to every point of the liquid and walls of the container.

questions.question: In a hydraulic press, if the area ratio A₂/A₁ = 100, then force ratio F₂/F₁ is:
questions.explanation: According to Pascal's law, F₂/F₁ = A₂/A₁. If area ratio is 100, force ratio is also 100.

questions.question: Hydraulic brakes work on the principle of:
questions.explanation: Hydraulic brakes work on Pascal's law, where pressure applied at brake pedal is transmitted through brake fluid to all wheels simultaneously.

questions.question: A hot air balloon floats because:
options: Hot air is lighter than cold air
questions.explanation: Hot air balloon floats because hot air has less density than cold air, creating a net upward buoyant force greater than the balloon's weight.

questions.question: When an object is completely submerged and sinks, the condition is:
questions.explanation: When an object sinks, its weight is greater than the buoyant force acting on it.

questions.question: Pressure at a given depth in a liquid depends on:
questions.explanation: Pressure at a given depth depends only on the depth and density of the liquid, not on the shape or area of the container.

questions.question: If pressure on a smaller piston is P and area is A₁, then force on larger piston of area A₂ is:
questions.explanation: According to Pascal's law, pressure is same on both pistons. Force = Pressure × Area, so force on larger piston is PA₂.

questions.question: The principle behind lifting heavy objects with hydraulic jack is:
questions.explanation: Hydraulic jack works on Pascal's law, allowing a small force on small piston to lift heavy load on large piston.

questions.question: In the equilibrium condition of a cylinder in liquid, the net force is:
questions.explanation: In equilibrium, the resultant force acting on the cylinder must be zero, balancing upward and downward forces.

questions.question: Guericke's experiment with copper hemispheres demonstrated:
questions.explanation: Guericke's experiment with evacuated copper hemispheres demonstrated the enormous force exerted by atmospheric pressure.

questions.question: The density of mercury used in Torricelli's barometer is:
questions.explanation: Mercury has a density of 13.6 g/cm³ or 13,600 kg/m³, which is why it's suitable for barometer measurements.

questions.question: If an object has the same density as the fluid, it will:
questions.explanation: When object density equals fluid density, weight equals buoyant force at any depth, so it remains suspended wherever placed.

questions.question: The force exerted by a fluid on a submerged object acts:
questions.explanation: Fluids exert force normal (perpendicular) to the surface of submerged objects due to pressure acting perpendicular to surfaces.

questions.question: In a hydraulic system, if force F₁ = 10 N is applied on piston of area 2 cm², what pressure is transmitted?
questions.explanation: Pressure = Force/Area = 10 N / 2 cm² = 5 N/cm². This pressure is transmitted undiminished throughout the fluid.

questions.question: Why can mosquitoes walk on water while humans cannot?
options: Gravitational force is less on mosquitoes
questions.explanation: Mosquitoes can walk on water due to surface tension, which can support their light weight without breaking the water surface.

questions.question: The advantage of hydraulic systems is:
questions.explanation: Hydraulic systems provide mechanical advantage by multiplying force - a small input force can produce a much larger output force.

questions.question: At sea level, atmospheric pressure can support a mercury column of height:
questions.explanation: Standard atmospheric pressure at sea level can support a mercury column of 760 mm (76 cm) height.

questions.question: In Pascal's law applications, the work output compared to work input is:
questions.explanation: Work output equals work input in hydraulic systems (ignoring friction). Force is multiplied but distance moved is reduced proportionally.

questions.question: The buoyant force on a completely submerged object depends on:
questions.explanation: Buoyant force depends on the volume of fluid displaced, which equals the volume of the submerged object.

questions.question: Pressure in liquids is transmitted:
questions.explanation: According to Pascal's law, pressure in liquids is transmitted equally in all directions.

questions.question: If the depth of water in a dam is doubled, the pressure at the bottom becomes:
questions.explanation: Since P = ρgh, pressure is directly proportional to depth. Doubling depth doubles the pressure.

questions.question: A submarine experiences maximum pressure when it is:
questions.explanation: Pressure increases with depth (P = ρgh), so maximum pressure occurs at maximum depth.

questions.question: Archimedes discovered the principle of buoyancy while:
questions.explanation: According to historical accounts, Archimedes discovered buoyancy while taking a bath and noticing the displacement of water.

questions.question: In a hydraulic brake system, brake oil serves to:
questions.explanation: Brake oil in hydraulic brakes primarily serves to transmit pressure from the brake pedal to all four wheels simultaneously.

questions.question: The center of buoyancy is located at:
questions.explanation: The center of buoyancy is the center of gravity of the displaced fluid volume, where the buoyant force effectively acts.

questions.question: When a body floats in equilibrium:
questions.explanation: For a floating body in equilibrium, the weight equals the buoyant force, resulting in zero net force.

questions.question: Pascal's law is applicable to:
questions.explanation: Pascal's law applies to both liquids and gases (fluids) since both can transmit pressure equally in all directions.

questions.question: The pressure at the bottom of a lake depends on:
questions.explanation: Pressure at the bottom depends only on the depth of water (P = ρgh), not on surface area, volume, or shape.

questions.question: In a hydraulic lift, mechanical advantage is achieved by:
questions.explanation: Mechanical advantage in hydraulic lifts is achieved by using pistons with different cross-sectional areas.

questions.question: Atmospheric pressure decreases with altitude because:
questions.explanation: Atmospheric pressure decreases with altitude because the height of air column above decreases, reducing the weight of air pressing down.

questions.question: The condition for an object to float is that its average density should be:
questions.explanation: For an object to float, its average density must be less than the density of the fluid it's placed in.
